pageContent:
Customizing the AD to RE Transfer

Presented by Rebecca McCollum
Union Institute & University
6/2/2016 © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc. – Dallas, TX
June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan

Who is responsible?

At Union we elected to have the Admissions office send the data because we wanted the transfer to occur at the same time as the completion of the student's physical file, and we "hand off" the two simultaneously

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

The selection process – who is transferred and when?

By Infomaker Query – Allows for high selectivity and specificity By individual candidate(s)
By query within AD-RE Transfer window

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Settings – Insert vs. Update

Process Controls
Degree History & Div Master

Insert/Update Options

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan

© 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

What information transfers are available?

Candidacy: Tuition
Status

Candidacy: Yr/Trm
Candidacy: Location

Candidacy: Housing Cde
Candidacy: Deposit Amt

Organizations: End
date of HS listed

Candidacy: Degree Candidate: Last
Org Attended
Candidacy: Program

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Please note…

The "profiles" for the AD to RE transfer (including the settings, the selection process, and which data goes) must be saved on each user's machine. If multiple people are running the same profiles, be certain that the profiles are identical

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

And now what we've all been waiting for….
……. CUSTOMIZATION!

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Which fields are not updated by the transfer?

 Admit Program
 Concentration
 Certification
 Entrance Code
 Holds
 Non-degree checkbox
 User-defined fields

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Step 1: Update Type

Create New Term of Courses  Update Definition
1) In the first column (update type), right click to go to the Maintenance screen. This will take you to the Maintain Table Values Window
2) Right click to add a row. Create an update type using your school's initials. Save and close the window.

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Step 2: Update Definition

Create New Term of Courses  Update Definition
1) Right Click to Add a Row
2) Update Type: Select the new type you just added
3) Update Code: Create a code identifying what the rule will be updating (Admit Program, Certificate, etc.)
4) Process Type: Update
5) Target Table: Identify the table that holds the field to be updated
6) Target Column: Identify the column (field) to be updated

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

View of Completed Rules (one for each field update)

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Step 3: Update Definition User Access

Create New Term of Courses  Update Definition User Access
Select the group you are in (and any other groups that run the AD-RE transfer). Drag from left to right all of the codes you just created. Save.

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Step 4: Update Results and Rules

Create New Term of Courses  Update Results and Rules
1) Select an update type from the top window (for example, CERT)
2) On the Results Definition tab, right click to add as many rows as possible resulting codes (if you have 3 certificate values, add 3 rows).
3) Note that the update table/column that you provided is listed in the header
4) Enter each resulting code you want to go into the destination table during the transfer

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Update Results/Rules View

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Updating Results and Rules, cont.

1) Highlight one of your "resulting code" rows
2) Select the "Results Rules Definition" tab
3) On the Rules Table/Column/Expression column enter the corresponding field that will determine the update definition. For example, if you are recording concentrations in a udef field, list the udef field to which that the transfer refers
4) Write the rules. You can create AND and OR statements if necessary (For example, candidacy.prog_cde = BSM AND candidacy.dept_cde = MKT). A positive outcome for the rules will result in the code being populated in the target field.

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Writing the Rules:

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Step 5: Update Cluster Definition

Create New Term of Courses  Update Cluster Definition
1) In the Cluster to Maintain section, right click to add a row.
2) Create a cluster code (i.e. ADR) and assign a group that has access to this cluster.
3) Move all of your AD to RE codes from "Available Codes" to "Selected Codes." They are now part of the cluster that can be selected when you run the AD to RE transfer.

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Cluster Definition View

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.

Select your new cluster!

June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.
